publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support.

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support.
S1M-472 Water Charges (lodged on 27 January 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-472 Water Charges (lodged on 27 January 2000) Mr Gil Paterson*, Alex Neil*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill
S1M-472 Water Charges (lodged on 27 January 2000) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-472 Water Charges (lodged on 27 January 2000) Linda Fabiani*

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges-That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani
S1M-472 Water Charges (lodged on 27 January 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie
S1M-472 Water Charges (lodged on 27 January 2000) Christine Grahame*

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame

S1M-472 Tommy Sheridan: Water Charges—That the Parliament notes with concern the impact of increased water charges on low-income households in Scotland; calls upon the Scottish Executive to bring forward a more radical plan to protect low-income households which should include a cap on households on income support, and agrees that the increase in water and sewerage charges should be no greater than the percentage increase in income support. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie, Christine Grahame
